title: The Naked Farmer account promoting rural mental health shut down by Instagram
text:
A social media account dedicated to raising awareness for farmers' mental health was suspended by Instagram.

Ben Brooksby, who runs The Naked Farmer, found out the account was suspended last week when he tried to log in.

He told the Today Show from his west Victorian property he had tried to contact Instagram a few times but had never heard back from them.

Ben Brooksby (pictured), who runs The Naked Farmer, found out the account was suspended last week by the picture-sharing application when he tried to log in

He told the Today Show from his west Victorian property he had tried to contact Instagram a few times but had never heard back from them

'Everyone did a bit of an uproar. It was empowering to see our naked farm community and what it means to everyone. It was quite amazing the support I got from everyone,' he said.

The account was back online on Monday night, with Mr Brooksby uploading a picture of himself in a field to announce it.

'We're back,' he captioned the Instagram post.

'Massive thank you to our Naked Farmer community for the huge amount of support. Our voices were heard.

'When the media contacted Instagram to get a comment about the Instagram getting taken down they quickly responded saying that it was an error with their system and they apologised.'

He told the Today Show he had accepted that it was a content review issue.

The account was back online on Monday night, with Mr Brooksby uploading a picture of himself in a field to announce it

He told the Today Show he had accepted that it was a content review issue

Mr Brooksby said he accepted Instagram's explanation it was a content review issue

'We do have to understand that certain people use their platform but you'd think someone so big like Instagram would have some more people to talk to,' he said.

He said he'd sent in a few forms but was unsure if a human or computer was getting it.

'Of course I accept their apology and I totally understand,' he said.

The Naked Farmer started in 2017 and is dedicated to raising awareness around rural mental health, and particularly farmers.

Mr Brooksby said it is all about starting a conversation around mental health.

They also run a calendar every year.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Instagram for comment.
